definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The impact impaired the power of the imperialistic country.
sentences.chinese: 這種衝擊削弱了這個帝國主義國家的實力。
它是具有侵略性和帝國主義性質的。

sentences.english: Chinese editorials said South-East Asians should not be hoodwinked by imperialists.
sentences.chinese: 中方各大報紙表示東南亞各國不應讓帝國主義哄騙。

sentences.english: It also creates a sort of two-edged cultural imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 它還創造出一種雙刃的文化帝國主義。

sentences.english: This is an imperialist dog-eat-dog type of war.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場“帝國主義狗咬狗的戰爭”。

sentences.english: It is anti Japanese and anti-imperialist;
sentences.chinese: 帝國主義和殖民主義是雙重的罪惡。

sentences.english: The surrender of Japanese imperialism is now a foregone conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 日本帝國主義投降的大勢已經定了。

sentences.english: The imperialists will never lay down their butcher knives.
sentences.chinese: 帝國主義分子決不肯放下屠刀。

sentences.english: All the people had been armed to defend their country against imperialist and colonialists.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人被武裝抵禦帝國主義和殖民主義的國家。

sentences.english: Here too, there are signs of "imperial overreach".
sentences.chinese: 這裏同樣也有“帝國主義越界”的跡象。

sentences.english: He even wrote a defense of British imperialism during the Boer War.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至在布爾戰爭中爲英國帝國主義辯護。

sentences.english: Li Hongzhang was appointed to approach the imperialists and sue for peace.
sentences.chinese: 李鴻章被委派向帝國主義求和。

sentences.english: Japanese imperialism will never change its basic policy of subjugating China.
sentences.chinese: 日本帝國主義滅亡中國的根本方針是決不會變的。

sentences.english: Imperialism picked the resources of colony.
sentences.chinese: 帝國主義蒐括殖民地的資源。

sentences.english: I think there is an essential sort of imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲有這樣一種本質帝國主義的存在。

sentences.english: It signifies a decision to capitulate to Japanese imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 就是說決定投降日本帝國主義。

definition: Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
